reviewText: They must have filmed this mess in a week; Fonda, Gassman and Ryan must have grabbed their checks, turned up their trench coat collars and left through the back door. The print quality is awful, just as this nightmare of a movie is. It makes Ed Wood look like a genius.

It is always amazing-- and disappointing--when a top-notch cast appears in such a dreadful movie. The plot,the music, and the camera work insure that this will bore all who watch it-- unless they just  burst out laughing.

I bought the DVD from Sinister Cinema, a good company.

This is unfortunately the American theatrical version missing the 4th German chapter with Kinski. I saw this film in a theater and it's only 3 segments--Italian, French and American. If you like gritty B&W spy films of the 60's you'll like it. Gassman-Bucella episode is the best.
